climbs.name: Maybe I'm Amazed
climbs.fa: Vernon Phinney, Aug 2017  bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start uphill on the last staging platform.  Move up and left to chert blobs the size baby seals.  Step up on the large blobs of chert and clip the first bolt.  Continue up very large chert on fun climbing over amazing geology.
content.location: Leftmost route on the crag and just left of the route Burning Spear.

climbs.name: Light My Fire
climbs.fa: Mike Engle Aug 2017  bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney, & Mike Engle

content.description: Start up vertical featured grey limestone. Lieback up to a stance and continue up and slightly right to a slab move.  Gain a chert line and follow the easy but fun climbing to the anchors.
content.protection: 9 bolts and a sport anchor.  Single 60 meter rope will get you back to the ground.
content.location: There is large vertical water groove between the Burning Spear crag and Psychedelic Rock.  Start on the platform below the water groove and follow the obvious feature grey limestone just to the left of the water groove.

content.description: Work up to a thin move by the second bolt.  Get your feet high using low hand holds. From the stance, continue up on enjoyable chert, edges, and flakes.
content.protection: 5 bolts to sport anchors.  The original chain anchors were 'upgraded' with a steel carabiner and an additional open cold shut.
content.location: Follow the climber trail uphill to last platform. Burning Spear starts directly above the platform.  First bolt is powder coated tan and there is no name tag.

climbs.name: Born to Be Wild
climbs.fa: Chris Barnes Aug 2017, bolted by Chris Barnes, Vernon Phinney,,& Mike Engle

content.description: Fun route.  Formally the top rope route in the Bingham and TeNgaio guides.  Likely starts a little right of the original TR.  Climb solid grey limestone and the occasional chert knob to the anchors of the route Burning Spear.
content.protection: 6 bolts and sport anchors.  The original chain anchors on Burning Spear were 'upgraded' to sport anchors with the addition of a steel carabiner and an open cold shut.
content.location: To the right of Burning Spear 10a, Starts about 10' down the hill and shares anchor.
